subject: RE: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception ?
msgSnippet: You still need a fail after the try/catch to account for the possibility that no exception was thrown. ... __________________________________________________
messageBody:
You still need a fail after the try/catch to account for the
possibility that no exception was thrown.

--- Jason Rogers <jason.rogers@...> wrote:
> If you want to eliminate the boolean, use your first example and do
> the
> assert in the catch block.
>
> public void test_00_isPartnerAssigned() {
>
> try {
> instancePartnerHierarchyWorker.isPartnerAssigned(null);
> fail("IllegalArgumentException should be thrown.");
>
> } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
>
> assert(true);
>
> } catch (PartnerNotFoundException pnfe){
>
> fail("PartnerNotFoundException should not be thrown.");
>
> } catch (PersistenceException pe){
>
> fail("PersistenceException should not be thrown.");
> }
> }
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Mike Duffy [mailto:mduffy_lists@...]
> > Sent: Friday, July 13, 2001 11:24 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a
> thrown
> > exception?
> >
> >
> > Also, this is better than the structure I originally
> > proposed because
> > it eliminates the need for a boolean flag.
> >
> > --- Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...> wrote:
> > > > The Junit.org site has an FAQ section
> > > > (http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm) with
> > the following
> > > > question: How do I implement a test case for a thrown
> > exception?
> > > >
> > > > The answer they give is not completely correct because it
> does
> > > not
> > > > account for the possiblility that another exception could
> be
> > > thrown.
> > >
> > > I think they assume that your method only throws one
> > exception. If
> > > your method throws more exceptions, you can use:
> > >
> > > // Test IllegalArgumentException is thrown when
> > partnerID is null.
> > > public void test_00_isPartnerAssigned() {
> > > try {
> > > boolean assignedStatus =
> > >
> instancePartnerHierarchyWorker.isPartnerAssigned(null);
> > > } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
> > > return;
> > > } catch (Exception e) {
> > > fail("IllegalArgumentException should have been
> thrown.");
> > > }
> > > fail("IllegalArgumentException should have been
> thrown.");
> > > }
> > >
> > > -Vladimir
> > >
